abstract.p: Jill Hacker letter warns that dieting may send dangerous message that body's own signals need to be ignored (S)

block.p: An Oct. 23 letter writer makes an important point when she says that learning to fear food sacrifices ''patients' well-being to the oppressive social ideal of extreme thinness.''

But besides a fear of food, dieting may send the equally dangerous message that the body's own signals need to be ignored and overridden. Children on such diets are being set up for a lifetime of looking outside for answers that should come from within.

A healthier diet for children might be one that teaches them to eat only when hungry, rather than in response to a television commercial for junk food.
